contentrichtext.text: In [[Māori mythology]], '''Whiro''' (or '''Hiro''' in the [[Tuamotus]]) is the lord of darkness, or the embodiment of all evil. He is the brother and enemy of [[Tāne]]. He inhabits the [[underworld]] and is responsible for the ills of all persons. In some versions of this story, when people die, their bodies descend into the underworld, where they are eaten by Whiro. Each time Whiro eats a body, he becomes stronger. This process will eventually make him sufficiently powerful to break free of the underworld, at which point he will come to the surface and devour everything and everyone on it. [[Cremation]] is therefore recommended to prevent this, because Whiro cannot gain strength from ashes. ==References== * {{Citation | first = | last = | author-link = | title = Journal of the Polynesian Society, volume XXVI | place = Auckland, NZ | publisher = Polynesian Society (N.Z.) | year = | doi = | isbn = }} * {{Citation | first = Robert | last = Craig | author-link = | title = Dictionary of Polynesian Mythology | place = | publisher = Greenwood Press | year = 1989 | doi = | isbn = 0-313-25890-2 }} * {{Citation | first= | last = | title = Odyssey Magazine | place = Milwaukee, Wisconsin | publisher = Kalmbach Publishing | year = 2010 }} [[Category:Māori gods]] [[Category:Death gods]] [[Category:Night gods]] [[Category:Chaos gods]] {{Oceania-myth-stub}} {{Maori-stub}} {{deity-stub}}
